techmeme.title: American small-business owners who source goods from overseas, especially from China, and sell them online, face acute uncertainty about the tariffs' impact (Caroline O'Donovan/Washington Post)
EC president von der Leyen: the EU may tax Big Tech ad revenue, targeting Meta and Google, if Trump trade talks fail and won't revisit its "untouchable" rules (Financial Times)
Despite Trump admin pressure, Apple is unlikely to move iPhone production to the US soon due to facility, labor, and supply chain gaps only Asia can fill now (Mark Gurman/Bloomberg)
Source: Google laid off hundreds of employees in its platforms and devices unit, which works on Android, Pixel, and Chrome, after offering buyouts in January (Erin Woo/The Information)
Sources: OpenAI recently gave staff and third-party groups just days, vs. several months previously, to evaluate risks and performance of its latest models (Cristina Criddle/Financial Times)
